data.title: The Thick of It’s Rebecca Front in the therapist’s chair
data.meta_description: Rebecca Front has a killer combination of skills as a performer. She’s got fabulous comic timing. She also makes it all look utterly natural. Whether she’s flailing around as Nicola Murray in Armando
data.text:
Rebecca Front has a killer combination of skills as a performer. She’s got fabulous comic timing. She also makes it all look utterly natural. Whether she’s flailing around as Nicola Murray in Armando Iannucci’s Westminster comedy The Thick of It, playing Simon Amstell’s mum in Grandma’s House or — going back a bit — a profusion of comic characters in The Day Today or Knowing Me, Knowing You with Alan Partridge, you don’t sense the sweat. You just believe that she is who she says she is.

“Oh, good. I’m glad,” she says, with a smile from the other side of a giant coffee table in a Central London hotel. “That’s what I’m always going for. When I look at other people
